website_summaries.verdict: An affordable trolling motor that can be used in freshwater and saltwater, manufactured for Newport Vessels and other inflatables with a transom.
pros: This 46-pound thrust electric trolling motor has a 30-inch adjustable fiberglass composite shaft that is designed to fit all Newport Vessels
The motor features 8 speeds (5 forward, 3 reverse) and is powered by a 12-volt deep cycle battery or a marine battery (not included)
cons: There is some concern with it being hard to tell when you are changing speeds, especially when dropping to zero

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to know that they stand behind their product when ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 55# thrust trolling motor and use it in salt water. The motor casing started to rust so I called the Newport Vessels company and asked them about it. They had me email them pictures of it and a copy of the receipt showing when I purchased it. In a couple days they called me back and said that they were going to send me a New 55# thrust rolling motor. They figured something must had gone wrong when mine was manufactured. I received the new one a few days later via FedEx, no charge. It is nice to know that they stand behind their product when one fails to hold up. Excellent customer service. 5 STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Katrinamc

customer_reviews.title: ... three times in brackish so far and has been great. I use this for my hobie outback so ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this three times in brackish so far and has been great. I use this for my hobie outback so my total weight with myself and all my equipment is about 400lbs and in calm water I can get to speeds close to 5mph. There does seem to be a gap between the 4 and 5 speeds but it's still a good motor. With my everstart group 29 battery I can troll for close 8 hours on setting three which gets me to about 2.8mph. This is my first trolling motor so I don't have much to compare it too but it's been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trolling motor
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 55 lbs. thrust motor back in January. I used this motor a lot, at least once a week. Great motor the 3 blade prop. really makes a difference. Best customer service. I used it so much that I had to replace the motor control unit. Called them up and they replaced part for free with no questions asked. Added note: Even if I had to buy that part, the cost of the part was unbelievably inexpensive. Don't hesitate to the buy their products.
customer_reviews.author: David Wijtman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After searching and comparing the major brands, I decided to take a chance on this one based on reviews here & youtube videos I had seen. I wanted something rated for saltwater since I fish salt and fresh. I've had it out a few times so far & it's flawless. It moves my 15' canoe with 2 people & gear just fine for a full day of fishing. The telescoping handle is a plus also; very convenient and I didn't have to purchase an extra part for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikon Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic motor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an ANIMAL! I love it. I've got it mounted on my 12 foot Native Slayer and my depth finder shows me doing 10 mph at full speed, and that's with a weekend worth of gear! It will slow down to 7-8 mph when I'm bucking a 15 mph head wind and 2 foot waves. But, considering that I'd be going backwards at roughly twice that speed with paddles I'll take it! They've apparently taken some of the reviews into consideration, because the stops are very positive between speeds and the battery lights are very bright. The telescopic handle is an absolute must for a kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Motor at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: We needed a salt and freshwater trolling motor for our tandem kayak and researched many brands and models. This Newport Vessels motor exceeded our expectations at a price far below Minn Kota and other better known brands. Works great for us on freshwater lakes as well as in the Gulf of Mexico. Great customer service too.
customer_reviews.author: John4857

customer_reviews.title: A great motor. Lightweight with good power.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup for my 14 foot sailboat. I live on a twisty tidal river and given the right combination of lack of wind and tidal current, it can sometimes be difficult to sail in or out to more open water. The performance is good for my needs. I upgraded to a three blade prop and that has also helped.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hughes

customer_reviews.title: NOT for SALTWATER
customer_reviews.text: NOT made for saltwater!!! After 2.5 years of extremely light use on my son's 10 ft dinghy, the lower unit/motor housing has completely rusted apart which allows water to leak in and fry the motor. We've lived & boated in Florida all our life, so we know the importance of flushing and rinsing after saltwater use. This little boat is stored on a floating dock and every single time it's used it gets thoroughly rinsed off. Every single time without exception. This should not be marketed as a saltwater motor.
customer_reviews.author: HarborHopper

customer_reviews.title: Better or equivalent thrust for a lesser price
customer_reviews.text: Compare these to Minn Kota. Better or equivalent thrust for a lesser price. I used this all summer, 2-3 times a week, with never an issue. It pushes my 400 pound jon boat easily. I would buy this trolling motor again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brandes

customer_reviews.title: That it works but didn't
customer_reviews.text: It's a pos. First time I used it to go get my crab pots it died about 400 yards out. Had to row back in. Wind was up made it very difficult to get back in. Thought it have been the connection to the battery so tighten everything real good. Went back out it doed again about 300 yards out. Rowed back in. Sent the pos back to NV.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: but it moves four people with gear through the water just fine on my 14 ft jon boat
customer_reviews.text: I've gone back to change this review from 4 to 5 stars. It fell off the back of my boat, going down the highway at 55 mph and still works! Yes it's all scraped up as it was still hooked up to the battery, so I dragged it a quarter mile or so before pulling over. Yes the prop has some road rash, but this damn thing still works! This is one hell of a trolling motor! Original 4 stars was because I was expecting a little more power from 46 lbs of thrust, but it moves four people with gear through the water just fine on my 14 ft jon boat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whipple

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't seem that we materials used are as good as the Minn Kota
customer_reviews.text: I've been through 10+ Minn Kota motors of the same size. We burn through them at my work and I have been pleasantly surprised with the Newport unit. It doesn't seem that we materials used are as good as the Minn Kota, but so far it is handling everything I have thrown at it. And it is much cheaper. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this motor up to two, 12 volt (24v total) 122AH deep cycle marine batteries in my 12ft, 2 person aluminum jon boat. We cruised around for roughly 5 miles (maybe a hair over) with alot of our trip being on speed #5. The batteries still had about 25% charge left when we were done. All around great unit for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but loud
customer_reviews.text: This product came as advertised. Overall, nice product with quick delivery. However, I'm only giving it 3 stars because it is loud. If you are a prior owner of a Minnkota or Motorguide trolling motors, you are going to be surprised at how loud this motor is even on the lowest speed. Its will be OK for getting from point A to point B but if you need to get on the spawning beds silently, this is not the motor for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST trolling motor in the WORLD, HANDS DOWN!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had minnkota motors but I git to day this, this NEWPORT motor ROCKS ALL THE check boxes!! 1. Powerful 2. Quiet 3. Strong 4. Flawless operation I mounted it on my kayak, it moves it like a little boogie board! Turns on a dime and no nonsense operation. I even accidentally got a bunch of fishing string wrapped around the propeller, the motor thumped and continued to run like nothing ALL DAY! How I missed a good American Business and manufactured product. KUDOS TO ALL the employees at Newport! THANK YOU for a perfect product!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Electric Motor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the Intex Excursion 5 and it worked amazing! We were zipping around the lake like nothing! I even used it to tow a large inflatable raft with 8 people on it plus 4 people and two dogs in our Intex boat and we were able to put put around the lake even moving against the wind. Great powerful motor and would highly recommend. Get a large 12v battery to power it though because we drained that battery after a day and a half of use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N

customer_reviews.title: Dont listen to bad reviews, buy it you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Newport Vessels 55lb thrust trolling motor for my 14' flat bottom boat. Only used once so far for a few hours but in that time I had 3 full size adults w gear. Motor performed flawlessly, even against a small headwind it was able to move fully loaded boat at a good jogging speed. Definitely I don't feel the least bit disappointed in any expectations of performance or quality. I hope to and plan on getting many years of great use out of it and see no signs as of yet as to not accomplishing that. Highly reccomend and would likely buy again granted I dont have any issues in the next few year's.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph s Shmouse

customer_reviews.title: Good power for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Battery meter Good power Cons: Mount only so-so Not a smooth increase in power. Got this a few weeks ago, took it out once. The motor has functioned well, the battery meter is a nice feature. At full speed it pushed an 8'6" dinghy along at about 4 mph. The downside is that the step from level 4 to level 5 is a bit abrupt - "turbo". This can make the mount pop out, which is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: I love my 55lb saltwater troller
customer_reviews.text: The price, the saltwater model 55 thrust was almost 200$ cheaper than minn kota's 30lb. freshwater. I guess some people think u cant use a saltwater troller in freshwater (whatever). This motor pulled my fat butt around my favorite fishing spot all day with a old battery half charged. The battery level feature on handle is real nice, motor noise was no issue. I'll put NEWPORT VESSELS up against anybodys trollers, my fishing buddy has already switched to NEWPORT VESSELS.
customer_reviews.author: gary goins

customer_reviews.title: Failing after 18 months replaced by great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I made my concerns know to Newport and they responded immediately. After explaining some details they authorized a replacement (after 18 months of my use) and I got a new motor in 2 days! they explained that a malfunction in coating process caused my problem. Would not hesitate to deal with this seller. This motor powers a tender for a cruiser on San Francisco Bay (salt) , it lives on a davit and is never left in the water. All around the end of the motor is rusted and and it is now vibrating on high speed. It does still work, but I doubt for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: bunky

customer_reviews.title: Up in a cloud of smoke
customer_reviews.text: We received this motor on July 11th and used it approx 8 times. On the 8th trip out on August 20th it started smoking, then took off on its own forward then backwards. Then the smoke got a little heavier and it died completely. We estimate that we used the motor for a total of 6 hours before the catastrophic failure.
customer_reviews.author: lori bedell

customer_reviews.title: But for now I'd say it's a great trolling motor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I set this up on my 13.5 foot fishing kayak to make it easier to get to and from my fishing spots. It has no trouble propelling me around at about 5 mph. Seems well made the only question would be how long it lasts. I've had it out a few times now and have ran it at about 80% power continuously for up to 30 minutes before without any problems (I had it set on 5th speed but have a PWM between it and the battery). If that should happen to change any time soon, I'll update my review. But for now I'd say it's a great trolling motor for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little motor and super duper quiet
customer_reviews.text: Just understand that 46lbs is not a lot of thrust and you will be moving at a slow walking speed most likely. As your battery loses energy the number five setting will drop down to something more like the four setting and then the three setting and then the two setting. I think you get the point. It cannot maintain top speed as your battery drains. If you run it on five then your battery is going to drain much faster. Keep it at three and you WILL go much farther. Also remember, you cannot 'farther' your education ('farther' describes physical distance, and further is figurative). You're welcome. :)
customer_reviews.author: RedmondReviewer

customer_reviews.title: great motor
customer_reviews.text: I use this trolling motor, 46 lbs of thrust, for my freshwater, 14ft, john boat. I troll, stop and fish, troll some more, etc... This purchase was better than I ever dreamed. I fish about 6-8hrs using a cheap lawn tractor battery, 300cca, that I picked up from Rural King. I've never run below 4 lights, so this motor does not suck the power out of batteries. I would purchase another, if I needed to. The only issue I have is that the transom clamp isn't deep enough. It bites into the molding aluminum on my transom. It needs about a half inch to allow the clamp screws to clear the moulding and bite only into the transom.
customer_reviews.author: Prof H

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great price point. Very durable. Good fit and finish. Expanding handle works well. Only gave it four stars cause if you expand the handle you can’t see what gear you are in because gear number is located too far down the handle. Noise level from motor is slightly louder than my old minn Kota but doesn’t seem to scare any fish away. Directions said to cover motor from rain to protect electronics. I placed an old latex gym over the top of it when I am not using it. Overall I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: andrew pofahl

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, fun motor
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install - just clamp it to the back of your boat. I am using it on a 9.4 ft Sun Dolphin dinghy. I connect it to a 100 amp-hour battery, which should provide about 3 hours of power. It is quiet and a fun, cheap way to get out on the water. I uploaded a short video of me driving by the Queen Mary ocean liner to give a sense of the sound and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rich, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying the 55 lb thrust!
customer_reviews.text: A great trolling motor! It moves my 14 foot smoker craft with no problem even with three other people in it. My only criticism would be that the mechanisms that raise and lower the shaft and set the height are a mix of plastic pieces and metal screws that I’m fearful may not last the test of time. But until then I’m enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Sailboat Motor
customer_reviews.text: I use this motor to push a 16' tri hull sailboat called a Windrider. The boat only weighs about 250 lbs but with three hulls there is a lot of area for wind resistance. With high winds and seas the 55 lb thrust is capable of moving the boat forward at top throttle speed. However, I would not want anything less than a 55 lb thrust for my needs. Great motor and very quiet. It has already saved me from being stuck out in a calm sea. It has also made my coming and goings into docks a more manageable situation. Love the motor so far.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good motor with excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Solid motor. Good enough to push my 12ft boat. I'm especially impressed by their customer service and technical support, especially the guy called Nick. They were very patient to help when my motor stopped working. They also offered detailed instructions on how to fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bing Icefairy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase and I look forward to many years of reliable use. I purchased this motor as an auxiliary for my small sailboat and it moves it through water very nicely and I trust it to work whenever I need it. Very handy and easy to see battery condition meter.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon scooter

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box, doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Just received the trolling motor today. Straight out of the box hooked the battery up to give it a test before even getting on the water, first thing I notice is the 5 speeds forward aren't functioning properly. Speeds 1-3 are the same, speed 4 doesn't work at all - nothing just dead - and speed 5 seems to work. The reverse speeds similar thing, the first 2 are the exact same then the third is faster. If the product works okay enough it might be worth it since it is a very cheaply made Chinese product, but disappointed from the get-go.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fridell

customer_reviews.title: Great for trolling
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 foot aluminum fishing boat with a 15 hp outboard engine. The boat weighs about 450 lbs, the engine weifghs ankther 150 lbs, And my gear another 30 lbs. this motor is fabulous! It pushes my boat at almost 2 1/2 knots. Great for trolling! Great as an emergencybackup if my 15 hp outboard conks out! Love this motor!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great, solidly built motor. I utilize this motor on my Feather-Raft. It provides enough power to move me easily through the water for hours. On my first use I had an issue with vibration. After a bit of troubleshooting with the customer service rep he deemed that there was a manufacturing problem with my motor. 3 days later I had a brand new motor delivered. No hassle they just made it right. If you are looking for a product that is backed by a company with integrity this is the place to go.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Sult

customer_reviews.title: Prop fell off on first use! Company made it right and did it immediately
customer_reviews.text: Update: 8/27 The company contacted me immediately and did an absolutely exceptional job making this right! I can enough good things about how well this company takes care of their customers!! 100% recommended The prop fell completely off on the very first use of the motor. I called the company and left a message with no return call as of yet. I will gladly update the review if they are able to provide a new prop.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Huffstetler

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent motor! I purchased the 35Ah battery, and wish the LED display would show a smoother decrease in battery life instead of showing full most of the time & then quickly start dropping. We’ve used it about 20 hours now in both salt as well as fresh waters. Really nice to have it as a backup to our kayak paddles!
customer_reviews.author: Dale M. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this Trolling motor
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this Trolling motor. Although I have only owned one other, which was a foot controlled Minn-Kota on a fresh water bass boat, the quality is very much on par (or exceeds because this is a saltwater version). I have it mounted to an Old Town Saranac 146 canoe, and it is perfect. The telescoping handle is very useful in this configuration, and worked out better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McClure

customer_reviews.title: Good Working Motor
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. I bought it for salt water use and it works just fine. I accidently ran the motor into a rock surface under the water and the motor just kept on going. There is minor rust from where the rock scraped the motor, but that is due to the fact I havn't washed it with fresh water. Recommend always to rinse your motor end with fresh water after use.
customer_reviews.author: korn8558

customer_reviews.title: Great for a canoe!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my canoe. Used it in the Gulf of Mexico. I ran on it for about 4h and still had 1/2 battery life left (100AmpH). I'm a bit worried that it's not rainproof, but I can always drop a bag over it once it pours. It's pretty fast too. I think I got some 5mph speed with two people and a canoe full of gear and coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great motor.  Fully satisfied with the item.
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with this motor. I have run it in both saltwater and freshwater, as advertised. Having five forward speeds is a big advantage for maneuverability and trolling speed options. This motor is sturdy, but not too heavy. I use it in on a 2-man kayak with motor mount accessory: Lifetime Sport Fisher 100 Kayak. If you are looking for a on-top 2-man kayak/motor combo at a good price, this is one good way to go.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Chatson, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: solid operation and a great price. Gonna probably buy another one for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Been out with it on a half dozen adventures and it has performed flawlessly! Lots of power, reasonable battery drain, solid operation and a great price. Gonna probably buy another one for a second kayak I have. When i find a product that works, I stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT TROLLING MOTOR! I use it on a 14' Semi V aluminum boat. I do not have an outboard so I go full speed often to get to my spots. (Fishing) Battery life is far better than my older Minn. Quite, easy to install and use. You can "feel the quality " as soon as you take it out of the box. My son only has use of his left arm and he can install and use it. No more Minns for me!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Great Dinghy motor.
customer_reviews.text: Almost bought a ePropulsion or a Torqeedo electric motor that has its own battery, but both are around 2K. This little motor really pushes a 10' dinghy around really nice. Not a speed demon but get you to and from the dock. Can stow it below deck and with a separate deep cycle battery you can charge with a normal battery charger or solar panel. Can't beat the price...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pushes a two man raft decent. A kayak would ...
customer_reviews.text: Pushes a two man raft decent. A kayak would fly, so much less drag. It lets my raft go all over the bays, coast and even a number of miles offshore. Silent on pulling up to the fishing spots, and handles kelp no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the motor a few times and it is what I expected and I think a good value. But my purpose for writing is the customer service. I unknowingly had a bad battery and called and chewed out Nick with Newport for sending me a defective motor! He sent a new motor without even asking for the "bad" one. Once I realized it was my battery I contacted Nick. I'm sending the replacement back and he's sending me a shirt! Well done, Nick!
customer_reviews.author: Readersinc.

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 55lb thrust motor and man is it fast! I put it on a 14 foot aluminum boat and it had both me and my friend (together over 350lbs) moving fast enough to cause a wake! and for this low of a price!? I’m seriously thinking about mounting this one on my 8 foot Jon boat and purchasing the strongest one available for my 14 footer just because it really is a bang for your buck 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Omar M

customer_reviews.title: First day on the water the motor made a "pop" noise and no longer works
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to put this motor on my intex Excursion 5 inflatable boat. Connected it to a 12 Volt battery with the included circuit breaker. Ran for about 2 minutes then made a "pop" noise. After that the motor will not start/ work at all. very surprised to find I blew the motor 2 minutes in on its maiden voyage especially with the circuit breaker attached and from a brand like Newport. Had to row back to shore. Started the return process which was easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Rafe J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stops working and drains battery fast
customer_reviews.text: What is the customer support number for this company? Still the same issue with my trolling motor cutting out on high and draining battery quickly. I've tried multiple marine and deep cycle batteries. Same result.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: This is an expensive Anchor!!!! Don’t buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: Took it out to use for the first time. Going forward only speed 1 and 5 worked and in reverse only speed 2.5 worked. Not impressed with this product and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schafer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great motor. I use it to push my 16 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motor. I use it to push my 16 foot fiberglass boat around the lake. The motor will go for at least 6 hours on low speed. there are a lot of stumps in the lake so low speed is usually what I use.
customer_reviews.author: Captain John

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and deliver great performance on a four-person inflatable boat
customer_reviews.text: I had put this motor through three excursions for crabbing and fishing. Each time, it performed spectacularly. It pushed my Intex Mariner 4 with full crabbing gears and others without breaking a sweat. I used a 100Ah Duracell Marine Deep Cycle battery and this thing went full speed (Speed 5) for 7 hours straight non-stop with 10% battery left at the end of the trip. Quiet, powerful, let's hope that it can hold up with time. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KzzNv

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He LOVES it! Says it’s quiet and works very well. He’s thrilled with it!
customer_reviews.author: Maybeaddicted

customer_reviews.title: Great trolling motor
customer_reviews.text: This trolling motor is just as good as any motor on the market! I bought it for a Pelican bass boat that it moves with no problem at all speeds, I have even used it to troll 4 rods out the side and back of the boat for 5 and a half hours, with the battery still at 3/4 charge. I would highly recommend this motor to any one.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Biccum

customer_reviews.title: So Far Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: As you see the carton was damaged (UPS Ground). After making my motor mount using scrap treated plywood I secured the bracket by drilling the rails. This winter will sand shape and paint the bracket. After unboxing, I was pleased that the manufacturers packaging kept the unit in tack, appeared that there was no physical damage. After mounting I did connect the electrical to test the unit the best I could. All LEDS work, prop spins, forward/reverse speeds work. The test will be this weekend when I am able to use the motor. Will update my rating accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Can power much larger, heavier boats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my dinghy, but I found it will power my 34-foot sailing cat as well. It will actually get it up to 2 knots! The power of this little thing is pretty amazing. I did mange to break the swivel mount locking mechanism doing this however, but that was easily fixed using a couple of bolts to secure it in place. This is NOT a design flaw by the way! I'm using this in a way that it's not really intended for. The swivel mount is plenty strong for its intended use, which is on dinghy's and small boats- not big sailing catamarans.
customer_reviews.author: B Zolt

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: Gift. Came with problems had to send back to dealer and they replaced with working unit
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Hanlon

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Power
customer_reviews.text: I've had MANY Minn Kota and Motorguide trolling motors. I like this motor better than the motors I've had from either of those companies. The components in the Newport Vessels motor are made for salt water, so they are extra durable. Second, the Newport has power to spare. I've had four or five 55 lb thrust motors from Minn Kota, and the Newport Vessels motor seems to push a little harder. I like the battery gauge on the handle which lets you know if you are running low. This is an up and coming company, and I will give them my business again.
customer_reviews.author: Wittenberg

customer_reviews.title: Reliable service and motor
customer_reviews.text: How do I know this brand? My friend showed me an old motor without working. I checked the name. It is Newport. I opened the handle, found the burned control rotor. I searched online, found Newport part for $20. So the motor works again like new. When I hunt for another motor, I bought 55LB Newport one. Everything is perfect, only small tip I found, if you leave gear on between 2-3, there is some zzz-z sound from motor. I guess the control give out two combination or some shortage there. So I am very careful just place gear exactly 1,2,3,4,or 5 not in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Pretty strong
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my little scanoe. Love that it has led battery life. Doesn't drain my deep cycle battery and lasts multiple fishing trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kayle Brooke

customer_reviews.title: not good..don't purchase never
customer_reviews.text: this is my second review ...i put now 1 star after it was 5. this motor gets overheat in no time. the weather is cold now and wires gets over heat in 2 minutes and control head also. i have another motor but never get hot. this motor is realy poor. now iam worry about corrsion and heat ...this thing is rabbish..garabage
customer_reviews.author: Boater

customer_reviews.title: always bought minn kota in past found this product to be just as as good if not better
customer_reviews.text: bought the 46 lb. thrust and found it does the job just fine. Runs 3 to 4 hs. on a marine battery trolling depending on the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Gas is the way to go! Propeller and pin built cheap. Left me stranded.
customer_reviews.text: So the motor itself is great it ran well, and was easy to set up. But after running it for like an hour it was very sluggish and we ended up getting stranded in the middle of the bay and had to paddle almost 3 miles. The prop ended up stripping out of the pin and we were unable to fix it in open water. Rendering the motor useless. It runs ok on our inflatable boat. We have an intex excursion 4 and it worked well. It does pull the motor mount down a bit though. Overall the propeller is built cheap and will be buying a gas motor to give my boat a little more power.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to ream out battery connection on the motor wiring positive side only
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, very powerful. Had a slight problem with wiring connection, the hole in the connector on the positive wire had to be reamed out before it would fit over the contact post on my battery box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: power indicator is nice, had out 3 hours in Tampa bay and still read full.
customer_reviews.text: Used one time, I have it on a 12 foot jon boat with the big Walmart marine battery, it goes about a running pace with just me in the boat, power indicator is nice, had out 3 hours in Tampa bay and still read full. Its a new battery. you can adjust it up if it is to far under your boat, or opposite. It is quite, powerful and I think I will get years of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is very loud for an electric motor
customer_reviews.text: The motor arrived in good condition. Worked as expected. I used in on a side mount for my 14 foot canoe in windy conditions and it pushed it quite well. I would give it more stars but it is the loudest trolling motor I have ever used. It runs virtually silent in reverse, but in all forward speeds, it is very loud. I don't know if this is just an issue for my motor or if all of them make this much noise.
customer_reviews.author: Lanore

customer_reviews.title: Kept dying at high speed
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. If I ran at 5 for extended period it would throttle down to about 1/3 power. I'd have to turn it off for a while, then it would seem to run at 5 for a bit again. I suspect it was over heating. Return was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbfrommn

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully !
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my Parents pontoon. Works great! They love it. Motor sound is quiet, it runs on a wide variety of levels and is not bulky. Super smooth ride as well. Came quickly and for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: iminsomuchlove

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work as it should, I thought I would have a little more speed but I am pushing a 12.5 inflatable with full size adults. Runs a long time trolling with a 35 amph battery (four hrs), not very long on high speed about 30 minutes
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: It works great for my Sportpal 14 ft. canoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the meter on top to show how much battery you have left. It didn't seem to use as much power as I thought it would. I was out on a windy day and used it in high speed across the lake into the wind a couple times and it did very well. I'm thinking the quality of the shaft is better than min kota and the handle was more heavy duty as well. The transom mount made of plastic worries me but is good so far.
customer_reviews.author: todd

customer_reviews.title: I like the value to lbs thrust
customer_reviews.text: I like the value to lbs thrust. It certainly gets me around the lakes I like to fish on. I have to admit, though, that one time I bumped into something and after that, even though the propeller is ok and everything seems fine, there seems to be a vibration now on the fastest speed. Also, I took a friend out who knew more about trolling and he wished the motor could go slower. The boat I have it on, is a 14' aluminum 1948 Crestliner (Lund-Watercraft Seaman). Finally, I did not purchase it to do trolling, but to scoot me around the lake until my fish finder found some good sized fish and I would fish there.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Hand down best value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that I am not guessing whether my battery is going to leave me stranded or not. The Battery indicator is a life saver. Also, this motor is super quiet and with a fully loaded 16ft canoe, according to the GPS on my phone I was clocking at 4.3 knots! Very comfortable pace to get me anywhere safely.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Thing is junk. Stranded on lake twice. When I pulled the trolling motor out of water it appears the seal leaked and lower housing fillled up with water and shorted out trolling motor ? Would be nice to get a refund or replacement trolling motor. Nothing like oaring boat half mile across the lake!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms other 86lb thrust
customer_reviews.text: I have a Newport Vessels 46lb Thrust trolling motor. Great maintenance free motor. I also have 2 - 86lb thrust. My Newport 46lb will out perform the 86lb from other vendors. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice trolling motor. I have used it on a 10' inflatable boat and a 12' jon boat. It pushed both boats around with no problem at all. I have an 80ah battery and it doesn't drain it at all after fishing all day. Newport Vessels is a great company with great products.
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for trolling motors!
customer_reviews.text: This trolling motor is better than I expected! This thing has some serious power for my setup. It's whisper quiet and gives me the ability to enjoy the water in a way that is Covid-19 friendly. My local water hole is a great place to spend time with my family and get away from daily stresses. I highly recommend this product if you are in the market for something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for a canoe or kayak
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my canoe to fish the sounds. It’s fast. I can go about 10 mph. The battery level indicator is very helpful. I would recommend this to anyone. Oh and their customer service is off the hook. They stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Rakib

customer_reviews.title: No serial number, no registration website.
customer_reviews.text: Product has no serial number, so there is no way to register the product. How can they warranty? No registration website??? So if something malfunctions, I'll be rowing back to shore, try to troubleshoot the problem and if unresolved, then headed to the boat store and have to buy a motor that will back up there product.
customer_reviews.author: brian e popp

customer_reviews.title: Newport NV 46 fits in my sailboat's motor well and runs great
customer_reviews.text: Easily backs 23 ft Sailboat out of the slip and out onto the bay where sails can be hoisted. When I came back from my sail, it allowed me to do a nice controlled docking back into the slip. Battery still showing a full charge!
customer_reviews.author: Salty Joe

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For the low price that it is, it performs and works great. It is touchy at the off position but it is easy to figure out. I was surprised at how little my old trolling battery fared while running this trolling motor. Had little effect on the charge dropping down as I had run it on full power for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: bosn

customer_reviews.title: Plesently surprised
customer_reviews.text: Great little motor! I put it on a sneak boat for duck hunting. Plenty of power to chew through moderate weeds. Moves me and all my gear close to 5mph and I have a useable range of about 3 miles at full speed. More than enough to get me there and back
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great motor, wish i would’ve gone with a smaller one. It’s heavy and i feel the 36 would have been better for the battery . I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first trolling motor. I love it. It works perfectly, it light, appears well made, and was easy to set up. It has an excellent price for a saltwater motor, but only time will tell if it holds up to corrosion. It has plenty of power to push my 10 ft dinghey around at harbor speed. It seems plenty quiet to me, but then I amnot trying to fool any fish.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: ideal for trolling.
customer_reviews.text: We ran this all day at trolling speed with no measurable drain on a full size deep cycle battery. It ran smoothly at speeds 1-3. Above 3, our ten foot aluminum bottomed inflatable vibrated. All we wanted was to troll. When we want to travel, we will use a gas outboard.
customer_reviews.author: John Elliott Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a substitute for a small gas outboard and also as a replacement of a weaker, older model of another brand. Everything was as promised. Very easy to unpack and set up. Although I have used the motor just once, it did better on the battery than I projected.
customer_reviews.author: Fred From Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof. Speed controller burned out
customer_reviews.text: Used five times in ocean, performance quickly decreased each time. 6 of the 8 speeds no longer work. Fuse pops frequently. Opened up the motor to find sea water inside.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Park

customer_reviews.title: good power
customer_reviews.text: works great on my Mariner 4 boat and Everstart 24DC battery
customer_reviews.author: TapSnapOrNap203

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my aluminum flat bottom boat for the lake. With a nice size battery you can Cruze around all day. Easy to install and remove. I leave it outside, but out of the sun most of the summer. Seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for small boat
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Have small boat similar to Craigcat. Wanted to power with electric motor and this one is perfect. Have about 3 hours on it. Weight is good. Easy to mount and remove. Hits 5 mph Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great motor!
customer_reviews.text: What else could you ask for with a price like this? Just set some night lines and it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: John Dowhamyla

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, sturdy and good design. Easy to install and adjust, controls are responsive and well laid out. 62 lb engine has more than enough power and is very quiet. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Expvet

customer_reviews.title: Way better than rowing!
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased with the first one I ordered a second. I use them on my dinghies coupled with a lithium ion battery that only weighs about 10 pounds and it sure beats rowing!
customer_reviews.author: bbiggio

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Took this out once in a saltwater bay. Moved very nicely in my blowup. I have an intex excursion 4. Perfect push power. Easy to use and seems to be relaible. Ill post again after a few trips
customer_reviews.author: Ian hill

customer_reviews.title: Better shop around !
customer_reviews.text: I was upset to find out I could buy brand new cheaper directly from manufacture. Also my motor was missing SHEAR PIN AND NUT for propeller. Big hassle to find locally and put together. Sad face...
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Positive feedback rating. As described. Shipped fast. Well packed. Gr8t price!
customer_reviews.text: Positive feedback rating. As described. Shipped fast. Well packed. Gr8t price!
customer_reviews.author: TiefeSchwartz

customer_reviews.title: Hoping it’s as good as first impression!
customer_reviews.text: Came promptly...well packaged and very nice. My only confusion was putting on the propeller, directions are weak Haven’t tried in water but hoping it works Otherwise seems very strong but will see if enough power for my 12 ‘ aluminum boat
customer_reviews.author: R. Fantaroni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motor!
customer_reviews.text: Use this to motor my dinghy to my boat wich is in a slip on an unatatched floating dock. I use a Duracell powerplus 600 to power it. What a great combo. I actually have years of growth on my dinghys bottom (will scrape it someday) and this motor scoots it along fantastically. It's lots easier and much more fun than rowwing!
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Extra power for my canoe.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to throw on the back of my canoe to motor around the marsh in my back yard. First extended time out with it and I was pleased with the performance. Was able to fight a stiff current with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little motor. I have not had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! this is my turn trolling motor. Last one got bound up in weeds and didn't realize it was still in motion and fried it. Don't get me wrong will not say anything about minn kota they we're good to me it broke because of me. But now I'm a NEWPORT fan. Especially love the circuit breaker it comes with so my carelessness Will not happen again. Highly recommend this product. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: ben harp

customer_reviews.title: Dont waist your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought new. Within a 4 hours on the motor the thing had caught fire while we where on the water. Everything WAS CONNECTED PROPERLY. Wire had shorted out and $400 gone..
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great power! Great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this trolling motor to put in the back of an inflatable 10 foot dingy. We use it in a lake and it works great. We had two adults in the boat and pulled 2 adults behind us in an inflatable kayak for 2 hrs nonstop and didn't even move the battery off of full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

product_meta.title: Newport Vessels NV-Series 46lb Thrust Saltwater Transom Mounted Trolling Electric Trolling Motor w/LED Battery Indicator & 30" Shaft
product_meta.description: Style:46lb ThrustThe 46lb NV Series offers a tried and true design, ready to tackle any fishing excursion. The 3 blade propeller offers near silent operation, so you never scare away fish! With 46lbs of thrust at your fingertips, and a bright 5 point LED battery meter, this motor keeps you on the water all day long. A durable nylon transom mount, and a 30-inch adjustable shaft, means this motor can fit nearly any small to medium personal watercraft. High quality, corrosion resistant hardware ensures this motor is ready for any environment, with saltwater and freshwater compatibility. Ease-of-operation, quality, and efficiency make this motor the #1 choice in its class.
feature_bullets: 46lb Thrust - The ultra-quiet, cool and efficient 46lb NV Series allows you to fish all day long without overheating, or scaring away fish
30-inch Composite Fiberglass Shaft - High-strength, fully adjustable shaft allows for proper depth placement in all water conditions

8 Speeds and 6-Inch Telescoping Handle (5 forward, 3 reverse) - Ergonomic extendable handle, 5 forward speeds, and 3 reverse speeds puts total control at your fingertips for a smooth and controlled ride
5-Point LED Battery Meter - Super bright battery indicator provides immediate charge level. Note: The NV 46lb motor requires one (1) 12V deep cycle or marine battery (battery not included).
Saltwater Compatible Hardware - Stainless steel, zinc, and magnesium hardware ensures the motor is ready for fresh or saltwater
2 Year Warranty - We stand behind every product we make with industry leading customer service and a 2 Year Warranty.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,532 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
